title: Farm Tractor Tire Repair at Home

tasks.task: Working on a flat tractor tire and preparing for its removal and repair.
subtasks: Checking the condition of the tire and identifying the cause of the flat.
Using a tool to remove the tire from the rim.
Identifying and addressing a problematic pin that prevents easy removal.
Cleaning the inside of the rim where the flat occurred.
Applying primer and paint to the damaged rim to prevent further rust.
Patching the holes in the tire using Gorilla Tape and epoxy.
Installing a new tube and checking the air pressure for proper inflation.
Preparing the tractor tire for future use by ensuring all components are secure and functional.

tasks.task: Jacking up the tractor and the trailer.
subtasks: Raising the tractor to a safe working height using jack stands and blocks of wood.
Ensuring the safety of the raised position with additional jack stands.
Aligning the tractor and trailer for convenient access during tire replacement.

tasks.task: Repairing the bumper hitch.
subtasks: Assessing the necessary repairs for the bumper hitch and planning the work.

tasks.task: Working on the flat tractor tire.
Jacking up the tractor and trailer.
Fixing the bumper hitch.
Fix the flat tractor tire and prepare the trailer for movement.
Fix the bumper hitch on the trailer.
Fix the flat tractor tire.
Fix the bumper hitch on the trailer.
Prepare the tractor and trailer for upcoming field work (e.g., fall planting or harvest). Given the timing.
Fix a flat tractor tire.
Repair the bumper hitch on the trailer.
Repair the bumper hitch on the trailer. However, given the lack of info, maybe keeping it simple.
Fix the flat tractor tire (including jacking up the tractor). Then MAINTASK: Repair the trailer's bumper hitch.
But considering the way the questions are presented – one task per line, MAINTASK per task. Let me try to list the steps as presented.
Fix the flat tractor tire.
Jack up the tractor and the trailer.
Repair the trailer's bumper hitch.
the first one being working on the tractor's tire and getting it up, and the second one being fixing the hitch. But integrating the jacking task into the first MAINTASK as a subtask.
Work on the tractor and trailer to address the flat tire and prepare for future use.
Fixed a flat tractor tire and addressed a bumper hitch issue.
subtasks: Removed the flat tire from the rim.
Cleaned and prepared the rim for future use.
Repaired and patched the inner tube.
Reinstalled the repaired tire onto the rim.
Applied protective measures to the rim (primer, paint).
Fixed a flat tractor tire (including jacking up the tractor).
Raised the tractor safely using jack stands and blocks of wood.
Positioned the trailer for clear access.
Assessed the condition of the trailer's bumper hitch.
Repaired any damaged or worn components on the bumper hitch.
